title: How to Change Text Display or Font Size in iOS Mail

steps.title: Open the Mail app.
steps.content: Open the Mail app. Starting with iOS 13, the Mail app includes a formatting toolbar that allows you to change the font size in the text of an email. If you can’t find this feature, update your iOS , then launch the new Mail app. [1] X Research source In older versions of iOS, the only way to change font size in the text of an email is to copy and paste the formatted text from another application, such as Notes or Safari. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Compose button.
steps.content: Tap the Compose button. Locate the Compose button in the lower right corner of the Mail app home screen, then tap it to start composing a new message.

steps.title: Select the text you want to format.
steps.content: Select the text you want to format. Type something into the main text box in the composition window, then double-tap the text you want to select. When you do this, the Formatting Bar will open up at the bottom of the screen, above the keyboard. If you want to set the font size before entering any text, tap inside the text window, then tap the < button on the top right side of the keyboard. This will open the Formatting Bar . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Aa button.
steps.content: Tap the Aa button. In the Formatting Bar at the top of the keyboard, tap the Aa button at far left. This will open a new menu with a variety of options for formatting your text. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Choose the big or small A buttons to change the font size.
steps.content: Choose the big or small A buttons to change the font size. In the middle of the second row of formatting buttons, look for two A buttons. One is slightly smaller than the other. The small button will make the font size smaller, while the larger one will make it bigger. Tap either button multiple times to keep making the text bigger or smaller. [5] X Research source If you’ve selected some text, these changes will only apply to your selection. Otherwise, they will be automatically applied to anything you type into your email.

steps.title: Add Text Size to your Control Center.
steps.content: Add Text Size to your Control Center. In iOS 15, you can change the default text display size in individual apps. To get started, open the Control Center by swiping down from the top right corner of your screen. If you don’t already see the Text Size button (which looks like a small A next to a big A): [6] X Research source Open the Settings app, then select Control Center . Under the More Controls , tap the Add button next to Text Size . Now you should see the Text Size button when you open the Control Center.

steps.title: Launch the Mail app.
steps.content: Launch the Mail app. Go back to your Home Screen and tap the Mail icon to open the Mail app. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Control Center.
steps.content: Open the Control Center. With the Mail app open, swipe down from the upper right corner of the screen to open the Control Center menu. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Text Size button.
steps.content: Tap the Text Size button. It looks like a small capital A next to a larger capital A. This button will likely appear near the bottom of your list of Control Center widgets. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Set the toggle to Mail Only.
steps.content: Set the toggle to Mail Only . You’ll see a wide toggle switch at the bottom of the Text Size screen that says Mail Only on the left side and All Apps on the other. Tap Mail Only to apply your changes only to the Mail app. [10] X Research source The button above the option you’ve selected will turn blue.

steps.title: Adjust the text size using the vertical slider.
steps.content: Adjust the text size using the vertical slider. In the middle of the Text Size screen, you’ll see a large vertical slider control similar to the ones you use to adjust brightness or volume in the Control Center. Slide it up or down to change the text size in the Mail app. [11] X Research source When you’re done, tap anywhere outside the slider to close the Text Size screen, then swipe up to close the Control Center . Keep in mind that this will only change how the text size looks to you in the Mail app (including the text in emails you’ve received as well as app menus and toolbars). It will not change how the text looks in email messages that you send out to others.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. In earlier versions of iOS, you have to set the default text size for all apps at once rather than individually. Start by launching the Settings app on your Home Screen. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accessibility.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility . In the Settings menu, scroll down until you find Accessibility . Tap it to open a new menu screen. [13] X Research source In iOS 12, select General from the Settings menu, then tap Accessibility . [14] X Research source

steps.title: Select Display & Text Size.
steps.content: Select Display & Text Size . In the Accessibility menu, tap on Display & Text Size . This will open a menu with several display options to choose from. [15] X Research source In iOS 12, these options are located in the main Accessibility menu. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Choose Larger Text from the menu.
steps.content: Choose Larger Text from the menu. Turn on Larger Text , then use the Font Size slider to adjust the text size. Your selection will be applied to all apps on your iPhone, including the Mail app. [17] X Research source Keep in mind that this will only affect the text display size on your iPhone. It won’t change how your emails look to the recipient.
